Package org.zaproxy.zap.extension.script

Class ExtensionScript

java.lang.Object
org.parosproxy.paros.extension.ExtensionAdaptor
org.zaproxy.zap.extension.script.ExtensionScript
All Implemented Interfaces:
CommandLineListener, Extension
public class ExtensionScript extends ExtensionAdaptor implements CommandLineListener

    • DEFAULT_CHARSET

      public static final Charset DEFAULT_CHARSET
      The Charset used to load/save the scripts from/to the file.

      While the scripts can be loaded with any Charset (defaulting to this one) they are always saved with this Charset.

      Since:
      2.7.0
      See Also:
      • loadScript(ScriptWrapper)
      • loadScript(ScriptWrapper, Charset)
      • saveScript(ScriptWrapper)

    • getScriptingEngines

      public List<String> getScriptingEngines()

    • registerScriptEngineWrapper

      public void registerScriptEngineWrapper(ScriptEngineWrapper wrapper)
      Registers a new script engine wrapper.

      The templates of the wrapped script engine are loaded, if any.

      The engine is set to existing scripts targeting the given engine.

      Parameters:
      wrapper - the script engine wrapper that will be added, must not be null
      See Also:
      • removeScriptEngineWrapper(ScriptEngineWrapper)
      • ScriptWrapper.setEngine(ScriptEngineWrapper)

    • hasSameScriptEngine

      public static boolean hasSameScriptEngine(ScriptWrapper scriptWrapper, ScriptEngineWrapper engineWrapper)
      Tells whether or not the given scriptWrapper has the given engineWrapper.

      If the given scriptWrapper has an engine set it's checked by reference (operator ==), otherwise it's used the engine names.

      Parameters:
      scriptWrapper - the script wrapper that will be checked
      engineWrapper - the engine that will be checked against the engine of the script
      Returns:
      true if the given script has the given engine, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • isSameScriptEngine(String, String, String)

    • isSameScriptEngine

      public static boolean isSameScriptEngine(String name, String engineName, String engineLanguage)
      Tells whether or not the given name matches the given engineName and engineLanguage.
      Parameters:
      name - the name that will be checked against the given engineName and engineLanguage.
      engineName - the name of the script engine.
      engineLanguage - the language of the script engine.
      Returns:
      true if the name matches the given engine's name and language, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • hasSameScriptEngine(ScriptWrapper, ScriptEngineWrapper)

    • removeScriptEngineWrapper

      public void removeScriptEngineWrapper(ScriptEngineWrapper wrapper)
      Removes the given script engine wrapper.

      The user's templates and scripts associated with the given engine are not removed but its engine is set to null. Default templates are removed.

      The call to this method has no effect if the given type is not registered.

      Parameters:
      wrapper - the script engine wrapper that will be removed, must not be null
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • registerScriptEngineWrapper(ScriptEngineWrapper)
      • ScriptWrapper.setEngine(ScriptEngineWrapper)

    • registerScriptType

      public void registerScriptType(ScriptType type)
      Registers a new type of script.

      The script is added to the tree of scripts and its scripts/templates loaded, if any.

      Parameters:
      type - the new type of script
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterException - if a script type with same name is already registered
      See Also:
      • removeScriptType(ScriptType)

    • removeScripType

      @Deprecated public void removeScripType(ScriptType type)
      Deprecated.
      (2.9.0) Use removeScriptType(ScriptType) instead.
      Removes the given script type.

      The templates and scripts associated with the given type are also removed, if any.

      The call to this method has no effect if the given type is not registered.

      Parameters:
      type - the script type that will be removed
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • registerScriptType(ScriptType)

    • removeScriptType

      public void removeScriptType(ScriptType type)
      Removes the given script type.

      The templates and scripts associated with the given type are also removed, if any.

      The call to this method has no effect if the given type is not registered.

      Parameters:
      type - the script type that will be removed
      Since:
      2.9.0
      See Also:
      • registerScriptType(ScriptType)

    • addScriptsFromDir

      public int addScriptsFromDir(File dir)
      Adds the scripts from the given directory and starts tracking it.

      The directory will be tracked to add or remove its scripts when a new script engine/type is added or removed.

      The scripts are expected to be under directories of the corresponding script type, for example: 

      
 (dir specified)
 ├── active
 │   ├── gof_lite.js
 │   ├── TestInsecureHTTPVerbs.py
 │   └── User defined attacks.js
 ├── extender
 │   └── HTTP Message Logger.js
 ├── httpfuzzerprocessor
 │   ├── add_msgs_sites_tree.js
 │   ├── http_status_code_filter.py
 │   └── showDifferences.js
 ├── httpsender
 │   ├── add_header_request.py
 │   └── Capture and Replace Anti CSRF Token.js
 └── variant
     └── JsonStrings.js
      where active, extender, httpfuzzerprocessor, httpsender, and variant are the script types.
      Parameters:
      dir - the directory from where to add the scripts.
      Returns:
      the number of scripts added.
      Since:
      2.4.1
      See Also:
      • removeScriptsFromDir(File)

    • removeScriptsFromDir

      public int removeScriptsFromDir(File dir)
      Removes the scripts added from the given directory and stops tracking it.

      The number of scripts removed might be different than the number of scripts initially added, as a script engine or type might have been added or removed in the meantime.

      Parameters:
      dir - the directory previously added.
      Returns:
      the number of scripts removed.
      Since:
      2.4.1
      See Also:
      • addScriptsFromDir(File)

    • getScriptCount

      public int getScriptCount(File dir)
      Gets the numbers of scripts for the given directory for the currently registered script engines and types.
      Parameters:
      dir - the directory to check.
      Returns:
      the number of scripts.
      Since:
      2.4.1

    • loadScript

      public ScriptWrapper loadScript(ScriptWrapper script) throws IOException
      Loads the script from the file, using DEFAULT_CHARSET.

      If the file contains invalid byte sequences (for DEFAULT_CHARSET) it will be loaded again using the (JVM) default charset, to load scripts saved with older ZAP versions (which relied on default charset).

      Parameters:
      script - the ScriptWrapper to be loaded (read script from file).
      Returns:
      the ScriptWrapper with the actual script read from the file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurred while reading the script from the file.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the script is null.
      See Also:
      • loadScript(ScriptWrapper, Charset)

    • loadScript

      public ScriptWrapper loadScript(ScriptWrapper script, Charset charset) throws IOException
      Loads the script from the file, using the given charset.
      Parameters:
      script - the ScriptWrapper to be loaded (read script from file).
      charset - the charset to use when reading the script from the file.
      Returns:
      the ScriptWrapper with the actual script read from the file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurred while reading the script from the file.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the script or the charset is null.
      Since:
      2.7.0
      See Also:
      • loadScript(ScriptWrapper)

      public List<ScriptWrapper> getTemplates(ScriptType type)

    • invokeScript

      public Invocable invokeScript(ScriptWrapper script) throws ScriptException
      Invokes the given script, synchronously, handling any Exception thrown during the invocation.

      The context class loader of caller thread is replaced with the class loader AddOnLoader to allow the script to access classes of add-ons. If this behaviour is not desired call the method invokeScriptWithOutAddOnLoader instead.

      Parameters:
      script - the script that will be invoked
      Returns:
      an Invocable for the script, or null if none.
      Throws:
      ScriptException - if the engine of the given script was not found.
      See Also:
      • invokeScriptWithOutAddOnLoader(ScriptWrapper)
      • Invocable

    • invokeScriptWithOutAddOnLoader

      public Invocable invokeScriptWithOutAddOnLoader(ScriptWrapper script) throws ScriptException
      Invokes the given script, synchronously, handling any Exception thrown during the invocation.
      Parameters:
      script - the script that will be invoked/evaluated
      Returns:
      an Invocable for the script, or null if none.
      Throws:
      ScriptException - if the engine of the given script was not found.
      See Also:
      • invokeScript(ScriptWrapper)
      • Invocable

    • handleScriptException

      public void handleScriptException(ScriptWrapper script, Exception exception)
      Handles exceptions thrown by scripts.

      The given exception (if of type ScriptException the cause will be used instead) will be written to the writer(s) associated with the given script, moreover the script will be disabled and flagged that has an error.

      Parameters:
      script - the script that resulted in an exception, must not be null
      exception - the exception thrown, must not be null
      Since:
      2.5.0
      See Also:
      • setEnabled(ScriptWrapper, boolean)
      • setError(ScriptWrapper, Exception)
      • handleFailedScriptInterface(ScriptWrapper, String)
      • handleScriptError(ScriptWrapper, String)
      • ScriptException

    • handleScriptError

      public void handleScriptError(ScriptWrapper script, String error)
      Handles errors caused by scripts.

      The given error will be written to the writer(s) associated with the given script, moreover the script will be disabled and flagged that has an error.

      Parameters:
      script - the script that caused the error, must not be null.
      error - the error caused by the script, must not be null.
      Since:
      2.9.0
      See Also:
      • setEnabled(ScriptWrapper, boolean)
      • setError(ScriptWrapper, String)
      • handleScriptException(ScriptWrapper, Exception)

    • invokeTargetedScript

      public void invokeTargetedScript(ScriptWrapper script, HttpMessage msg)
      Invokes the given script, synchronously, as a TargetedScript, handling any Exception thrown during the invocation.

      The context class loader of caller thread is replaced with the class loader AddOnLoader to allow the script to access classes of add-ons.

      Parameters:
      script - the script to invoke.
      msg - the HTTP message to process.
      Since:
      2.2.0
      See Also:
      • getInterface(ScriptWrapper, Class)

    • handleFailedScriptInterface

      public void handleFailedScriptInterface(ScriptWrapper script, String errorMessage)
      Handles a failed attempt to convert a script into an interface.

      The given errorMessage will be written to the writer(s) associated with the given script, moreover it will be disabled and flagged that has an error.

      Parameters:
      script - the script that resulted in an exception, must not be null
      errorMessage - the message that will be written to the writer(s)
      Since:
      2.5.0
      See Also:
      • setEnabled(ScriptWrapper, boolean)
      • setError(ScriptWrapper, Exception)
      • handleScriptException(ScriptWrapper, Exception)

    • invokeProxyScript

      public boolean invokeProxyScript(ScriptWrapper script, HttpMessage msg, boolean request)
      Invokes the given script, synchronously, as a ProxyScript, handling any Exception thrown during the invocation.

      The context class loader of caller thread is replaced with the class loader AddOnLoader to allow the script to access classes of add-ons.

      Parameters:
      script - the script to invoke.
      msg - the HTTP message being proxied.
      request - true if processing the request, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the request should be forward to the server, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.2.0
      See Also:
      • getInterface(ScriptWrapper, Class)

    • invokeSenderScript

      public void invokeSenderScript(ScriptWrapper script, HttpMessage msg, int initiator, HttpSender sender, boolean request)
      Invokes the given script, synchronously, as a HttpSenderScript, handling any Exception thrown during the invocation.

      The context class loader of caller thread is replaced with the class loader AddOnLoader to allow the script to access classes of add-ons.

      Parameters:
      script - the script to invoke.
      msg - the HTTP message being sent/received.
      initiator - the initiator of the request.
      sender - the sender of the given HttpMessage.
      request - true if processing the request, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.4.1
      See Also:
      • getInterface(ScriptWrapper, Class)

    • getInterface

      public <T> T getInterface(ScriptWrapper script, Class<T> class1) throws ScriptException, IOException
      Gets the interface class1 from the given script. Might return null if the script does not implement the interface.

      First tries to get the interface directly from the script by calling the method ScriptWrapper.getInterface(Class), if it returns null the interface will be extracted from the script after invoking it, using the method Invocable.getInterface(Class).

      The context class loader of caller thread is replaced with the class loader AddOnLoader to allow the script to access classes of add-ons. If this behaviour is not desired call the method getInterfaceWithOutAddOnLoader( instead.

      Parameters:
      script - the script that will be invoked
      class1 - the interface that will be obtained from the script
      Returns:
      the interface implemented by the script, or null if the script does not implement the interface.
      Throws:
      ScriptException - if the engine of the given script was not found.
      IOException - if an error occurred while obtaining the interface directly from the script ( ScriptWrapper.getInterface(Class))
      See Also:
      • getInterfaceWithOutAddOnLoader(ScriptWrapper, Class)
      • ScriptWrapper.getInterface(Class)
      • Invocable.getInterface(Class)

    • getInterfaceWithOutAddOnLoader

      public <T> T getInterfaceWithOutAddOnLoader(ScriptWrapper script, Class<T> clazz) throws ScriptException, IOException
      Gets the interface clazz from the given script. Might return null if the script does not implement the interface.

      First tries to get the interface directly from the script by calling the method ScriptWrapper.getInterface(Class), if it returns null the interface will be extracted from the script after invoking it, using the method Invocable.getInterface(Class).

      Parameters:
      script - the script that will be invoked
      clazz - the interface that will be obtained from the script
      Returns:
      the interface implemented by the script, or null if the script does not implement the interface.
      Throws:
      ScriptException - if the engine of the given script was not found.
      IOException - if an error occurred while obtaining the interface directly from the script ( ScriptWrapper.getInterface(Class))
      See Also:
      • getInterface(ScriptWrapper, Class)
      • ScriptWrapper.getInterface(Class)
      • Invocable.getInterface(Class)

    • getUnsavedResources

      public List<String> getUnsavedResources()
      Description copied from interface: Extension
      Extensions should return the user friendly names of any unsaved resources - if there are any the user will be given the option not to exit ZAP or, if the extension is bundled in an add-on that's being updated or uninstalled, not to continue with the changes.
      Specified by:
      getUnsavedResources in interface Extension
      Overrides:
      getUnsavedResources in class ExtensionAdaptor
      Returns:
      a List containing the unsaved resources or null if none
      See Also:
      • Extension.getActiveActions()

    • handleFile

      public boolean handleFile(File file)
      Description copied from interface: CommandLineListener
      Handle the specified file (in whatever way is appropriate). This will only be called for files specified on the command line without switches and which match one of the extensions returned by getHandledExtensions()
      Specified by:
      handleFile in interface CommandLineListener
      Parameters:
      file - the file provided through the command line
      Returns:
      true if the listener handled the file, false otherwise

      Get the list of extensions this listener can handle
      Specified by:
      getHandledExtensions in interface CommandLineListener
      Returns:

    • supportsDb

      public boolean supportsDb(String type)

      Specified by:

      Overrides:
      supportsDb in class ExtensionAdaptor
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getScriptIcon
